txt.en: Give your response to Karazgar
Ask Karazgar the questions you wish
Listen to what Karazgar has to say
Give Karazgar your response to his request
'Someone comes. I must be gone.'
Karazgar has confronted you at the Old Ford, but for the moment he has declared a truce. He wishes only to speak with you.
'You are a disappointment to me, [placeholder].'
DNT - Blah!
'If you change your mind, bring it to me here.'
DNT - Blah!
'I will leave you unharmed, while my patience lasts.'
DNT - Blah!
'It will not last forever.'
Karazgar has made his request of you: he wants you to give him the Black Book of Mordor.
'I will....'
Karazgar, the Weeping Warrior, has declared a truce and desires to speak with you.
Remain alert for the reaction of Karazgar, and stay on your guard.
'Someone comes. I must be gone.'
Karazgar has fled from the new arrivals on the road.
'Someone comes.'
Elrond and much of his household have made the passage of the mountains.
'Our combat must wait, [placeholder].'
'I must be gone.'
'We chose, and in return we were chosen.'
'Dulgabêth, Ugrukhôr, Urudanî...'
'Rûkhor, Nûlbanath, Mothgorod...'
'And I, greatest of them all.'

'I have come with much of my household across the mountains, by way of the High Pass, for the marriage of my daughter awaits us in Gondor. Aragorn Elessar has claimed the crown of that land, and it is Arwen's wish, and his, that they marry. She will remain by his side forever. I know the way of hard choices, and this is hers to make.

'Glorfindel accompanies us, as do many others of my folk. Some will attend Arwen at the wedding, and others there are who desired to see the lands beyond Imladris one last time before departing this Middle-earth. All are welcome, for such an occasion should be made as happy as can be, and more hearts make for merrier times. We travel light, but not without goods and gifts. I myself bring the Sceptre of Annúminas. It will be a gift for King Elessar, for it is his by right.

'It is my own desire that this journey be full of cheer, for my daughter's benefit, but this land holds only sorrow for me; I will be happy to leave it. I understand there is a pleasant house nearby at which we might find lodging. It was the home of Beorn the Skin-changer, and is kept now by his son, is it not?'
'Gulthauk's bite made us ageless and deathless.'
'Lead on, [placeholder]. I trust we will find the son of Beorn a hospitable host.'
'We were given what the Númenóreans desired but could not attain.'
'Endless, unceasing time. Or so we thought.'
Karazgar has confronted you at the Old Ford, but for the moment he has declared a truce. He wishes only to speak with you.\n\nHe waits for you to respond.
'Why should our fortunes wane with Sauron's?'
'Would you not fight to master your fate, [placeholder]?'
Karazgar has confronted you at the Old Ford, but for the moment he has declared a truce. He wishes only to speak with you.\n\nHe has given you the chance to ask the questions you wish.
'So it is with me.'
Karazgar has confronted you at the Old Ford, but for the moment he has declared a truce. He wishes only to speak with you.
'All I require is that you bring me the Black Book.'
'What say you?'
'It was in the Second Age that Sauron learned a truth that had escaped him.'
'He learned that despite his great power...'
'...there were some forces even he could not challenge alone.'
'The Nazgûl may have been Sauron's most powerful servants.'
'They were snared by the Dark Lord, and made to serve him.'
'But in some tasks they proved insufficient.'
'We Gúrzyul... we were different.'
'We flocked to him. We sought to worship him.'
'[placeholder], it is a pleasure to see you.'
'You took the coin of Gondor and the gifts of Elves, and you did their bidding.'
'You named yourself 'adventurer,' and you adventured.'
'So too did I.'
'We are much the same, [placeholder].'
'There is no reason we should not aid each other.'
'I am pleased to hear you can be reasonable, [placeholder].'
'I know the Wizard will not approve.'
'Remain alert. Eventually he must leave the Book unattended.'
'Meet me here when you have it.'
'I will....'
'It is an artifact of Mordor, is it not?'
'I do not seek the jewels of dwarves, or the lore of Elves.'
'I do not desire the treasures of Gondor.'
'I want only keepsakes of the land I served.'
Remain on your guard
'When the North belongs to me, as was promised...'
Wait for the newcomers to arrive
'...they will be a reminder to me of my many victories.'
'We are enemies. This is true.'
Talk to Elrond on the road near the Old Ford
'You stood in defence of your allies, the dwarves...'
'...and I slaughtered them by the dozen.'
'Have you not slain my allies?'
'We do not need to spill each other's blood, [placeholder].'
'Why can we not conduct our business and leave the other alone?'
'More dangerous fools than you have tried!'
'There is much we could learn from each other, to our mutual benefit.'
'Die, then!'
'Ask me what you will, and I will tell you much.'
'The Herald of Winter could not. What makes you think you can?'
'You disappoint me, [placeholder].'
'Die, then!'
Instance: A Request
'Do you see what an ally you could have in me, [placeholder]?'
'Seek information and I will give it.'
'Desire death for your foes and I will deliver it.'
Approach Karazgar and hear what he has to say
